comments:
Hi,

I cannot run 2 instances of eclipe using 2 different work spaces.

This is in the log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Sep 29, 2003 10:19:53.523
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:298)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:764)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:598)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: 
Configuration file "D:\DevelopmentTools\IDE\eclipse\.config\platform.cfg" is in
use by another instance of the platform, 
or there was a failure in deleting the old lock file.  If no other platform
instances are running, 
delete file "D:\DevelopmentTools\IDE\eclipse\.config\platform.cfg.lock" and try
starting the platform again.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.getConfigurationLock(PlatformConfiguration.java:1596)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.initializeCurrent(PlatformConfiguration.java:1476)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.<init>(PlatformConfiguration.java:882)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.startup(PlatformConfiguration.java:1377)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.initialize(InternalBootLoader.java:582)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:1044)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:838)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	... 7 more


Environment:
Win2000
Sun JDK 1.4.2
Eclipse 200309230800

Thanks
Rico
This problem only existed for that one build and has since been fixed.

causedBy.message: Configuration file "D:\DevelopmentTools\IDE\eclipse\.config\platform.cfg" is in use by another instance of the platform,  or there was a failure in deleting the old lock file.  If no other platform instances are running,  delete file "D:\DevelopmentTools\IDE\eclipse\.config\platform.cfg.lock" and try starting the platform again.
